snippet: A confidential assessment by the International Monetary Fund said the budget shortfall was caused by tax evasion, corruption and slow economic growth.
abstract: Afghan government is supposed to cover only 40 percent of its own bills in 2014, but achieving that modest goal is proving difficult; confidential assessment by International Monetary Fund says budget shortfall is caused by tax evasion, corruption and slow economic growth; cash crunch is seen as reminder that Afghan government remains weak.
lead_paragraph: A confidential assessment by the International Monetary Fund said the budget shortfall was caused by tax evasion, corruption and slow economic growth.

headline.seo: Afghan Government Faces Cash Crunch, I.M.F. Says
headline.print_headline: Afghans Are Said to Face A Large Budget Shortfall
